name: Coastal hazard and risk assessment for estuaries and near shore coastal areas
Description (not required on specs form): Surveying of estuaries and near-shore coastal for hazard/risk assessment

name: Mapping bathymetric changes through time for understanding coastal variability in coastal morphology
Description (not required on specs form): Understanding variability of coastal morphology through time

name: Substrate mapping for marine sediments on the inner-mid shelf
Description (not required on specs form): using bathymetry and backscatter data to map marine sediments on the inner-mid shelf

name: Mapping scallop habitats
Description (not required on specs form): Mapping and modeling of the seabed to identify preferred habitats of the SE QLD Saucer Scallop

name: Dredging safety and volume calculations
Description (not required on specs form): Volume calculations for payment purposes and also identifying hazards.
featuresOfInterest: Dangers to navigation or high spots in the dredging area
frequencyRange: 30-250 kHz.  Only use higher frequency for higher resolution of infrastructure.
positioningRequirementOther: CORS for inshore and near coastal.  AMSA beacon for areas covered and satellite when away from those services.  Post processed if higher accuracy is required.

name: Collecting and processing Airborn LiDAR Bathymetry (ALB) data
Description (not required on specs form): Collecting and processing Airborn LiDAR Bathymetry (ALB) data for coastal zone management and charting applications
featuresOfInterest: Features which are danger to navigation <30m typically.
timeSensitiveRequirements: Data must be collected at night
relevantStandards: IHO s-44 and ICSM LiDAR Acquisition Specifications and Tender Template

deliverables.name: Relative Reflectivity (ASCII XYrr, ECW Mosaic and GeoTiff Tiles)
Orthorectified Imagery (ECW Mosaic and GeoTiff Tiles)

name: Dredge support and channel monitoring
Description (not required on specs form): Dredge support and channel monitoring for shoals. providing volumes and checking for clearances from dredging works.
frequencyRange: MBES 200 and 400 kHz  but for SBP 4 to 15 kHz
positioningRequirementOther: Network RTK and single base station RTK
relevantStandards: S 44 standards for hydro graphic surveys.

name: Offshore geological mapping
Description (not required on specs form): Mapping the bedrock geology (and seabed substrate)

name: Hydrographic survey for producing reference surfaces for Airborn LiDAR Bathymetry (ALB) surveys
Description (not required on specs form): We (or our client) source MBES data to serve as "ground truth" for a subsequent ALB survey.

name: Benthic mapping across bathymetry surfaces
Description (not required on specs form): Benthic analysis data is modelled across bathymetry surfaces
featuresOfInterest: All seabed characteristics. Slope, Rugosity, Hardness, Etc.
relevantStandards: Australian Multibeam Guideline - MBES Working Group,  IHO - S44

name: Geological and habitat mapping
Description (not required on specs form): Use data for baseline and further monitoring. Integrate with other discipline data (sedimentology, hydrodynamic, geochem, ecology, SBP)
vesselType: national asset  with pool-mounted preferably  all size depending on depth
timeSensitiveRequirements: Collect data when there are no storms.
relevantStandards: australia MBES guideline  NESP guideline  MESH guideline  IHO  Industry specific

name: Bathymetric model in support of hydrodynamic modelling
Description (not required on specs form): to create a bathymetric model for input into hydrodynamic modelling software (e.g. Mike or Tuflow)

name: Harbour mapping using bathymetric SAS on AUV
Description (not required on specs form): Survey of Middle Harbour with bathymetric SAS (Kraken) on a REMUS 600 AUV
positioningRequirementOther: AUV positioning system - GPS and DVL-aided INS

deliverables.name: Difference statistics with MBES data (Images, matlab array, etc)

name: Depth monitoring
Description (not required on specs form): Identification of shoals or obstructions

name: Hydrographic Charting for port safety analysis and risk assessment
Description (not required on specs form): Port Safety work conducted based on a risk assessment profile. Contract work also conducted for dredge works, engineering design, seabed erosion monitoring, habitat mapping, environmental management

name: Hydrographic surveying and charting
Description (not required on specs form): Hydrographic Survey processing and semi-auto contour creation and sounding selection for nautical charting

name: Upgrading existing charts or for making new charts (Nautical Charting)
Description (not required on specs form): High resolution MBES is used to map the seabed for the purposes of upgrading existing charts or for making new charts.

name: Bathymetry for updating national hydrographic database
Description (not required on specs form): Bathy collected to update the national hydrographic database

name: Nautical charting for safety of navigation
Description (not required on specs form): safety of navigation

name: Hydrographic Survey for port depth declaration
Description (not required on specs form): Hydrographic Survey to Class A MSQ QLD Standards for port depth declaration (in Port of Hay Point)

group: Identifying wrecks and dives (Inc. leisure dives)
name: Plane wreck survey
Description (not required on specs form): determine the spread of the wreck site after trawler damage had occured

name: Substrate mapping (soft versus reef habitats) for Australian Marine Parks
Description (not required on specs form): Bathymetry and habitat mapping required for development and research application assessments, designing biological surveys, baseline monitoring, compliance patrols.

group: Marine construction and infrastructure (Inc. cables etc.)
name: Dredging support
Description (not required on specs form): The use of multibeam for supporting dredging in ports, rivers, lakes, etc.

group: Marine construction and infrastructure (Inc. cables etc.)
name: Pipeline Survey
Description (not required on specs form): MBES acquisition along a pipeline together with side scan.

name: Identification and ground truthing of sea floor
Description (not required on specs form): dentification and ground truthing of sea floor.  Involves use of backscatter to identify sediment compartments and sedment sampling and video ground  truthing
featuresOfInterest: Reef and marine sediment extent and location.
vesselType: 12m  Steber Craft - Bombora - OEH Research Vessel  8m Marln Braodbill - SeaScan ( on trailer ) hydrosurvey
positioningRequirementOther: Offshore - G2 Marine Star DGPS & POSPac post proc.  Nearshore - SmartNet RTK service / RTK Tides
relevantStandards: Intergovernmental Committee on Surveying & Mapping (ICSM)  National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) – Geodesy, Global Positioning

name: Reef detection
Description (not required on specs form): Using bathymetry and backscatter to identify 'reef' for marine conservation management
positioningRequirementOther: POS MV - G2 Fugro RTK coastal equivalent w vector heading and IMU

delvierables.name: Digitised reef extent and coverage (ArcMap shapes)

name: Mapping the spatial distribution of seafloor types, or species preference for the habitat
Description (not required on specs form): Producing a map of the spatial distribution of seafloor types, or species preference for the habitat

name: Habitat mapping
Description (not required on specs form): MBES survey for Geophysical Data Sources to integrate with observations using machine learning for habitat mapping

name: Habitat mapping and evaluating and use of relationships between species and their environment
Description (not required on specs form): Evaluate and use relationships between species and their environment using bathymetry/backscatter.

name: Delineate seabed habitat types for hydrodynamic and sediment transport modelling
Description (not required on specs form): delineate seabed habitat types and bathymetry and backscatter for hydrodynamic and sediment transport modelling

name: Habitat mapping and seafloor visualisation for marine park monitoring and managment
Description (not required on specs form): Habitat mapping and seafloor visualisation for Marine park monitoring and managment

name: Shallow water science
Description (not required on specs form): Run a shallow water echosounder for use in scientific projects  around Australia

name: Evaluation of sediment flux (accumulation vs erosion) and the effect of marine infrastructure
Description (not required on specs form): High-resolution multibeam sub-bottom profiling and Sediment sampling (BoxCore)

name: Extended Continental Shelf (ECS) Mapping
Description (not required on specs form): To delineate the outer continental shelf of the US/Australia.
timeSensitiveRequirements: Depends where - Arctic in late summer - Atlantic need to avoid hurricane season.
positioningRequirementOther: Differential GPS or better if available
resolution: depends on water depth from ~25m - 100m horizontal
horizontalAccuracy: ~ a few meters in deep water

deliverables.name: Chirp subbottom with metadata (SEG-Y with metadata)
Chirp subbottom with metadata (SEG-Y with metadata)

group: Maritime navigation (Inc. leisure, sailing and boating)
name: Corner inlet entrance survey
Description (not required on specs form): Survey of approach channel to Corner Inlet which is utilised by offshore oil and gas industry vessels
featuresOfInterest: Those that pose a hazard to navigation

group: Maritime navigation (Inc. leisure, sailing and boating)
name: Marina survey
Description (not required on specs form): survey of local marina

group: Marine construction and infrastructure (Inc. cables etc.)
name: Dredging Maintenance Surveys for port management
Description (not required on specs form): Pre-dredge, dredging, and post-dredge surveys

name: Mapping of canyons and sub surface features
Description (not required on specs form): Mapping of canyons and sub surface features to understand tectonics, exposure of seafloor rock samples, or natural sub surface seepage indicators.
featuresOfInterest: Pock marks, faults exposed at sea floor, or hard grounds

deliverables.name: Published reports and promotional material, Gridded data and imagery

name: Site survey for Oil and Gas
Description (not required on specs form): Site survey for a oil and gas field

name: Coastal hazard modelling
Description (not required on specs form): we are mostly interested in running coastal hazard models eg coastal erosion, inundation etc.  The current NSW project is specifically seeking to provide data on sediment compartments to enable us to refine coastal erosion models.
featuresOfInterest: Extent of sand/reef, bathymetry, sediment compartments
timeSensitiveRequirements: Data collection is best to be done in winter.
positioningRequirementOther: Applanix POS MV systems to provide position and 3-D motion information to support MBES/MPES acquisition. positioning are provided through delivery of base station data (Smartnet) across a mobile phone network with an RTK link through Networked Transport of RTCM Internet Protocol (NTRIP).

name: Mapping of active submarine faults
Description (not required on specs form): Mapping of a major transform fault boundary where magnitude 7 to 8 earthquakes are common and tsunamis can be expected.

name: Survey to determine location of hydrocarbon seeps and collect geochemical samples of the seafloor at seeps
Description (not required on specs form): in deep water (>1000m) bathy grid for geological interp,  (15-25m) backscatter grid (5m) for seafloor interp,  all water column interpreted (ping editing and feature detection).   SEep locations are determined and core sites chosen.  Backscatter is used to help guide the core within 10m of target.  Similar method for mineral deposits.

name: Compartment mapping
Description (not required on specs form): Mapping bathymetry and backscatter for an entire sedimentary compartment
featuresOfInterest:
The extent of reef and soft-sediment features. 

For reefs,  feature size and relief, and for soft sediments, the sediment facies.
vesselType: RV Bombora - 12 m single hulled fibreglass vessel

name: Exploratory seafloor mapping
Description (not required on specs form): map areas of seafloor not mapped with MBES

deliverables.name: COS software seafloor Processed Backscatter (ESRI formats)

name: Habitat Mapping across fisheries
Description (not required on specs form): Mapping distribution of habitat types across Fisheries

name: Habitat mapping targetting reef systems
Description (not required on specs form): Habitat mapping targeting reef systems in depth of 10-80 m

name: Identifying foot of slope points (FOS) for Extended Continental Shelf
Description (not required on specs form): To identify FOS points for thier ECS.

name: Mapping seabed habitats for identifying reefs and seagrass
Description (not required on specs form): efficacy of multibeam backscatter for identifying reefs and seagrass

name: marine geological science research
Description (not required on specs form): The use of (mainly) bathymetry data to identify seafloor features, such as canyons, landslides, drowned reefs etc. Backscatter data are also used, particularly if doing habitat mapping.

name: Hydrographic survey in support of port Maintenance
Description (not required on specs form): Port under-keel clearance survey, dredging operations survey, safe navigation

name: Seafloor type mapping
Description (not required on specs form): MBES, backscatter & sub bottom for seafloor type mapping

name: Sediment compartment mapping for coastal management
Description (not required on specs form): Multibeam and LiDAR mapping of coastal sediment compartments to determine bathymetry and substrate type to understand coastal processes and sediment dynamics.

name: Sediment mapping and grain size interpretation
Description (not required on specs form): Making sediment maps using backscatter data

name: Modelling changing bathymetry in the surfzone and nearshore
Description (not required on specs form): These data are required to test and improve numerical modelling of storms impacts at the coastline
timeSensitiveRequirements: immediately pre and post large storm events
